title: Linux cmake Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the CMake tool to build and manage C++ projects on Linux. This lab covers installing CMake, creating a simple C++ project, and understanding different build configurations.

meta.title: Linux cmake Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the CMake tool to build and manage C++ projects on Linux. This lab covers installing CMake, creating a simple C++ project, and understanding different build configurations.
meta.keywords: CMake, C++, Linux, build, configuration, scripting, programming

verify.name: Verify CMake Installation
verify.hint: Make sure that CMake is installed and the version is 3.22.1. You can check the version by running `cmake --version`.

steps.title: Create a Simple C++ Project with CMake

verify.name: Verify C++ Project Creation
verify.hint: Make sure that the cpp-project directory, main.cpp, CMakeLists.txt, and the built cpp-project executable exist, and that the executable outputs "Hello, CMake!".

verify.name: Verify Debug Build Configuration
verify.hint: Make sure that the build directory exists and the executable outputs "Build Configuration: Debug".

verify.name: Verify Release Build Configuration
verify.hint: Make sure that the build directory exists and the executable outputs "Build Configuration: Release".
